list_definition.definition: a tube which is wide-mouthed at one end and narrow-mouthed at the other through which liquid can be poured into a narrow bottle etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You will need a funnel if you are going to pour petrol into that can.

list_definition.definition: a chimney on a ship etc through which smoke escapes.

list_ex_of_english: Quite soon everybody will be funnelling themselves through the tunnel and not even going by air.

The relief road funnels the traffic instead of moving it.
From levintal to pathways to funnels.
Too much is funnelled through the south-east at present.
